visit.reason_for_visit: Annual eye examination and vision assessment

anamnesis.chief_complaint: Blurred vision when reading, especially in low light conditions. Patient reports difficulty focusing on near objects for the past 3 months.
anamnesis.history_of_present_illness: Patient has noticed progressive difficulty with near vision over the past 3 months. Symptoms worsen in evening hours. No pain, redness, or discharge. No recent trauma or foreign body sensation.
anamnesis.past_medical_history: Hypertension (controlled with medication), Type 2 Diabetes (diagnosed 2018), Previous cataract surgery OD (2020)
anamnesis.family_history: Mother had glaucoma, Father had macular degeneration
anamnesis.medications_current: Metformin 500mg twice daily, Lisinopril 10mg once daily, Aspirin 81mg daily
anamnesis.other_notes: Patient is a software developer, spends 8-10 hours daily on computer. Reports increased screen time due to recent project deadlines.

ophthalmic_exam.anterior_segment_findings_od: Clear cornea, deep and quiet anterior chamber, round and reactive pupil, clear lens (IOL in place)
ophthalmic_exam.anterior_segment_findings_os: Clear cornea, deep and quiet anterior chamber, round and reactive pupil, early nuclear sclerosis noted
ophthalmic_exam.posterior_segment_findings_od: Optic disc: Pink, well-defined margins, C/D ratio 0.3. Macula: Flat, good foveal reflex. Vessels: Normal caliber and course. Periphery: No tears or holes.
ophthalmic_exam.posterior_segment_findings_os: Optic disc: Pink, well-defined margins, C/D ratio 0.3. Macula: Flat, good foveal reflex. Vessels: Normal caliber and course. Periphery: No tears or holes.

refractions.notes: Patient reports improved clarity at distance
Patient reports improved clarity at distance

imaging_studies.findings: Normal macular thickness bilaterally. No signs of diabetic macular edema. Retinal layers well-defined.
Images obtained showing healthy optic nerve heads and macular regions. No diabetic retinopathy changes observed.

treatment_plans.recommendation: New spectacle prescription for progressive lenses
treatment_plans.details: Patient requires updated prescription for both distance and near vision. Progressive lenses recommended for seamless transition between viewing distances.
Monitor progression of nuclear sclerosis OS. Patient education provided regarding cataract symptoms to watch for.
Advised 20-20-20 rule (every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for 20 seconds). Recommend anti-reflective coating on new glasses and proper workstation ergonomics.

prescriptions.notes: For dry eye symptoms associated with prolonged computer use

prescription_items.instructions: Use before computer work and as needed for dryness
